_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The three things by which a fool is know: They don’t recognize when they’ve made a mistake.
When they do recognize it they don’t deal with it properly.
When someone else confesses a mistake to them, they don’t accept it properly.
The three things by which an astute pers: They recognize when they’ve made a mistake.
When they recognize it they deal with it properly.
When someone else confesses a mistake to them, they accept it properly.
